curriculumStandard: New York State K-12 Social Studies Framework - Grade 5: The Western Hemisphere
curriculumFocus: Geography, history, and cultures of the Western Hemisphere including the development of cultures, civilizations, and empires

topics.name: Mesoamerica (Maya, Aztec, and Inca)
topics.description: The curriculum covers the foundations, characteristics, and environmental adaptations of these complex societies
subtopics: Maya civilization - astronomy, mathematics, writing system
Inca society - road systems, terraced farming, Machu Picchu

media.title: The Road to El Dorado
media.relevance: Animated adventure introducing Mesoamerican cultures, myths, and the legend of El Dorado
media.notes: Fictional but excellent visual introduction to Mesoamerican aesthetics and architecture

objectives: Identify key elements of Mesoamerican architecture and art
Compare fictional vs historical El Dorado legends
Discuss cultural encounters between Europeans and indigenous peoples
preActivities: Locate El Dorado legends on a map
Review vocabulary: Mesoamerica, conquistador, temple, pyramid
discussionQuestions: How does the film portray indigenous people?
What was the real El Dorado legend?
How accurate are the buildings and cities shown?
extensions: Create a comparison chart: movie vs reality

media.title: The Emperor's New Groove
media.relevance: Comedic look at Incan-inspired culture, architecture, and society
media.notes: Lighthearted but shows Incan-style palaces, llamas, and Andean landscapes

objectives: Explore the role of llamas in Incan society
preActivities: Locate Andes Mountains and Peru on map
Show images of real Incan architecture for comparison
discussionQuestions: What elements of the film reflect real Incan culture?
How did geography affect Incan civilization?
What role did animals play in Incan life?
extensions: Create a Venn diagram comparing movie palace to Machu Picchu

media.title: Night at the Museum
media.relevance: Features Aztec exhibits and artifacts coming to life in a museum setting
media.notes: Fun introduction to museum artifacts from various civilizations including Aztec

media.title: Lost Kingdoms of the Maya
media.relevance: National Geographic documentary exploring Maya civilization archaeology
media.notes: Educational documentary suitable for classroom; shows actual archaeological sites

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Aztecs
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Aztec engineering and Tenochtitlan
media.notes: Focus on engineering achievements; may need to show in segments

media.title: Ancient Civilizations: Maya
media.relevance: Schlessinger Media educational video on Maya civilization
media.notes: Specifically designed for classroom use; grade-appropriate

media.title: Mysteries of the Ancient World: Machu Picchu
media.relevance: Explores the Incan citadel and engineering achievements
media.notes: Beautiful visuals of Machu Picchu; discusses Incan achievements

topics.name: Native American Cultural Regions
topics.description: The study of various Native American groups and their interactions with their environment and later with European settlers
subtopics: Plains nations - buffalo culture, nomadic life
Southwest cultures - Pueblo peoples, desert adaptations
Pacific Northwest tribes - totem poles, salmon fishing

media.title: Pocahontas
media.relevance: Depicts Powhatan culture and early English contact in Virginia
media.notes: Historically romanticized - excellent discussion starter about real history vs Hollywood; depicts Eastern Woodlands culture

objectives: Compare Disney's portrayal with historical records
Understand Powhatan culture and Eastern Woodlands life
Analyze first contact between English colonists and Native Americans
preActivities: Show map of Jamestown colony location
Review vocabulary: colony, chief, Powhatan Confederacy
discussionQuestions: How old was the real Pocahontas when colonists arrived?
What did the Powhatan people really think of the colonists?
How does Hollywood change history and why?
extensions: Write a diary entry from the real Pocahontas's perspective

media.title: Brother Bear
media.relevance: Features Pacific Northwest indigenous culture, spirituality, and connection to nature
media.notes: Good introduction to Native American spiritual beliefs and Pacific Northwest setting

media.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
media.relevance: Depicts Plains Indian culture and their relationship with horses
media.notes: Shows Lakota culture; discusses westward expansion's impact on Native peoples

media.title: Kaya: An American Girl
media.relevance: American Girl film set in 1764 featuring a Nez Perce girl in the Pacific Northwest
media.notes: Historically researched; shows pre-contact Native American life; perfect for this age group

media.title: We Shall Remain: Episode 1 - After the Mayflower
media.relevance: PBS documentary on Wampanoag people and early contact with Pilgrims
media.notes: PBS American Experience; tells story from Native American perspective

media.title: 500 Nations
media.relevance: Kevin Costner narrates comprehensive documentary on Native American history
media.notes: 8-part series; show relevant episodes; excellent primary source material

media.title: Hiawatha
media.relevance: Classic film about the legendary Iroquois leader who helped form the Iroquois Confederacy
media.notes: Older film; good introduction to Iroquois Confederacy concept

topics.name: European Exploration
topics.description: Motivations, encounters, and the effects of exploration on the Americas

media.title: 1492: Conquest of Paradise
media.relevance: Depicts Columbus's voyages and early encounters with indigenous peoples
media.notes: PG-13 - preview before showing; some violent scenes; teacher may select clips

media.title: Pocahontas
media.relevance: Shows early English exploration and settlement in Virginia
media.notes: Romanticized but good starting point for discussing exploration's impact

media.title: The New World
media.relevance: Terrence Malick's artistic depiction of Jamestown founding and Pocahontas story
media.notes: PG-13 - more historically accurate than Disney; select scenes for classroom

media.title: Conquistadors
media.relevance: BBC/PBS documentary following routes of Spanish conquistadors
media.notes: Michael Wood narrates; show relevant episodes on Spanish exploration

media.title: Columbus: The Lost Voyage
media.relevance: History Channel documentary examining Columbus's fourth voyage
media.notes: Focuses on exploration challenges and navigation

topics.name: Colonial America
topics.description: Life in the colonies, the development of social structures, and the lead-up to the American Revolution
subtopics: Jamestown settlement - first permanent English colony
Plymouth Colony - Pilgrims and Mayflower Compact
New England colonies - Puritans, town meetings
Colonial daily life - clothing, food, work

media.title: Felicity: An American Girl Adventure
media.relevance: Set in colonial Williamsburg, Virginia in 1775; shows colonial life and revolutionary tensions
media.notes: American Girl movie - excellent historical accuracy; perfect for this age group

media.title: Squanto: A Warrior's Tale
media.relevance: Disney film about Squanto and his role helping Plymouth colonists
media.notes: Shows both Native American and Pilgrim perspectives; Thanksgiving history

media.title: National Treasure
media.relevance: Adventure film featuring American history, colonial artifacts, and founding documents
media.notes: Fictional treasure hunt but teaches about Declaration of Independence and colonial history

media.title: Colonial House
media.relevance: PBS reality series where modern families live as 1628 colonists
media.notes: Shows daily life challenges; excellent for understanding colonial hardships

media.title: Desperate Crossing: The Untold Story of the Mayflower
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Pilgrims' journey and first year
media.notes: Detailed look at Mayflower voyage and Plymouth settlement

media.title: The Scarlet Letter
media.relevance: Depicts Puritan New England society and values
media.notes: R-rated - NOT for classroom; teacher reference for understanding Puritan society

topics.name: American Revolution and Independence
topics.description: The causes of the war, key figures, the Declaration of Independence, and the creation of the Constitution
subtopics: Boston Tea Party and colonial protests
Key figures: Washington, Jefferson, Adams, Franklin

media.title: Liberty's Kids
media.relevance: 40-episode animated series covering the American Revolution through young reporters' eyes
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - specifically designed for this age group; covers Boston Tea Party through Constitution

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: America Rock
media.relevance: Classic animated shorts: 'The Shot Heard Round the World', 'No More Kings', 'Fireworks'
media.notes: Short segments perfect for introducing topics; memorable songs aid retention

media.title: Johnny Tremain
media.relevance: Disney classic about a young silversmith's apprentice in Boston during the Revolution
media.notes: Classic Disney; shows Sons of Liberty, Boston Tea Party from young person's view

media.title: Felicity: An American Girl Adventure
media.relevance: Shows colonial Williamsburg on the eve of Revolution; addresses loyalty conflicts
media.notes: American Girl movie; historically accurate; shows divided loyalties in colonies

media.relevance: Musical depicting the Continental Congress debates leading to Declaration of Independence
media.notes: G-rated musical; engaging way to learn about Declaration debates

media.title: The Crossing
media.relevance: A&E film depicting Washington's crossing of the Delaware River
media.notes: Jeff Daniels as Washington; good for teaching about turning points

media.title: America: The Story of Us - Episode 1: Rebels
media.relevance: History Channel documentary covering the American Revolution
media.notes: Modern production with reenactments; engaging visuals

media.title: The American Revolution
media.relevance: A&E documentary series narrated by Charles Kuralt
media.notes: Comprehensive documentary; show in segments

topics.name: U.S. Government and Civics
topics.description: The three branches of government, the Bill of Rights, and the rights and responsibilities of citizens
subtopics: Bill of Rights - first ten amendments

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: I'm Just a Bill
media.relevance: Classic song explaining how a bill becomes a law
media.notes: Essential viewing; memorable and effective

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Preamble
media.relevance: Sets the Constitution's preamble to music
media.notes: Students can memorize preamble through the song

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: Three Ring Government
media.relevance: Explains the three branches of government
media.notes: Uses circus metaphor to explain branches

media.title: National Treasure
media.relevance: Adventure featuring the Declaration of Independence and founding history
media.notes: Exciting way to spark interest in founding documents

media.title: BrainPOP: Constitution
media.relevance: Animated educational video explaining the Constitution
media.notes: Subscription required; designed for classroom use

topics.name: Westward Expansion
topics.description: The movement of people across the continent and the related social changes and conflicts

media.title: An American Tail: Fievel Goes West
media.relevance: Animated tale of westward migration through immigrant mouse family
media.notes: Combines immigration and westward expansion themes

media.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
media.relevance: Shows westward expansion's impact through a wild horse's perspective
media.notes: Depicts railroad construction, cavalry, and Plains Indian culture

media.title: Kirsten: An American Girl
media.relevance: Swedish immigrant girl's journey to Minnesota frontier in 1854
media.notes: American Girl movie; shows pioneer life, immigration, frontier challenges

media.title: Lewis & Clark: Great Journey West
media.relevance: IMAX documentary following the expedition route
media.notes: Stunning visuals; excellent for teaching the expedition

media.title: Far and Away
media.relevance: Irish immigrants seeking land in Oklahoma Land Rush
media.notes: PG-13; select scenes about land rush may be appropriate

media.title: America: The Story of Us - Episode 2: Westward
media.relevance: History Channel episode on westward expansion
media.notes: Modern production; covers Oregon Trail, Gold Rush

media.title: How the West Was Won
media.relevance: Epic depicting 50 years of westward expansion through one family
media.notes: Classic epic; long but covers major westward expansion themes

topics.name: Civil War and Reconstruction
topics.description: The causes of the war (including the antebellum period and the abolitionist movement), major events, and the post-war Reconstruction era

media.title: Harriet Tubman: They Called Her Moses
media.relevance: PBS documentary about Harriet Tubman and the Underground Railroad
media.notes: Age-appropriate documentary designed for educational use

media.title: Addy: An American Girl Story
media.relevance: American Girl movie about an enslaved girl escaping to freedom during Civil War
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for this age; historically researched; appropriate treatment of slavery

media.title: Follow the Drinking Gourd
media.relevance: Reading Rainbow special about the Underground Railroad and the song
media.notes: LeVar Burton narrates; accessible introduction to Underground Railroad

media.title: Freedom Song
media.relevance: TNT film about a young freedom rider in the 1960s (connects to Civil Rights)
media.notes: While set in 1960s, connects slavery's legacy to Civil Rights movement

media.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
media.relevance: NOT RECOMMENDED - fictional; included as example of what to avoid
media.notes: DO NOT USE - R-rated fiction that misrepresents history

media.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
media.relevance: Classic biographical drama about Lincoln's early life and rise to presidency
media.notes: Black and white classic; shows Lincoln's journey to presidency

media.title: The Civil War (Ken Burns) - Selected Episodes
media.relevance: Definitive documentary on the Civil War; select age-appropriate segments
media.notes: Select segments carefully; some content may be intense; excellent primary sources

media.title: Liberty's Kids: Episodes on Slavery
media.relevance: Several episodes address slavery and the founders' compromises
media.notes: Age-appropriate treatment of slavery in colonial/revolutionary context

topics.name: Contemporary Issues (NYC Specific)
topics.description: Case studies of different modern countries in the Western Hemisphere to compare government and economic systems and explore current events
subtopics: Canada and the United States relations

media.title: Coco
media.relevance: Explores Mexican culture, traditions, and family values through DÃ­a de los Muertos
media.notes: Excellent introduction to Mexican culture; beautiful animation

media.title: Encanto
media.relevance: Explores Colombian culture, family dynamics, and community
media.notes: Showcases Colombian landscapes, music, and cultural heritage

media.title: Rio
media.relevance: Animated film set in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil showcasing Brazilian culture
media.notes: Shows Brazilian geography, Carnival, and environmental issues

media.title: Moana
media.relevance: Polynesian culture and Pacific Island navigation
media.notes: While Pacific Islands aren't Western Hemisphere, useful for comparing cultures

media.title: The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind
media.relevance: True story of innovation from Malawi - connects to global citizenship themes
media.notes: While set in Africa, excellent for discussing global issues and innovation

categories.name: Quick Clips & Educational Shorts
categories.description: Short-form educational content from YouTube, TED-Ed, Crash Course, and other sources - perfect for warm-ups, lesson supplements, or quick reviews

topics.name: Ancient Americas Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about Maya, Aztec, Inca, and Native American civilizations

media.title: The Maya Civilization Explained in 11 Minutes
media.relevance: Quick overview of Maya civilization
media.notes: Captivating History channel; good introduction

media.title: The Aztec Empire Explained in 10 Minutes
media.relevance: Overview of Aztec civilization
media.notes: Quick comprehensive overview

media.title: The Inca Empire Explained in 14 Minutes
media.relevance: Overview of Incan civilization
media.notes: Covers Machu Picchu, roads, and society

media.title: TED-Ed: The Rise and Fall of the Inca Empire
media.relevance: Animated TED-Ed lesson on Inca Empire
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - beautiful animation

media.title: TED-Ed: The Rise and Fall of the Aztec Empire
media.relevance: Animated TED-Ed lesson on Aztec Empire
media.notes: Excellent 5-minute overview

media.title: TED-Ed: The Maya Myth of the Morning Star
media.relevance: Maya mythology and astronomy
media.notes: Shows Maya astronomical knowledge

media.title: BrainPOP: Maya Civilization
media.relevance: BrainPOP intro to Maya
media.notes: Requires BrainPOP subscription

media.title: Native American Regions Overview
media.relevance: Overview of Native American cultural regions
media.notes: Good for geographic understanding

media.title: The Iroquois Confederacy Explained
media.relevance: History of the Haudenosaunee
media.notes: Democracy origins in Native America

topics.name: European Exploration Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about Columbus, explorers, and the Age of Exploration

media.title: TED-Ed: The Columbian Exchange
media.relevance: Explains exchange of plants, animals, diseases
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - essential topic explained well

media.title: The True Story of Christopher Columbus
media.relevance: More accurate history of Columbus
media.notes: Balanced view of Columbus

media.title: Simple History: Spanish Conquistadors
media.relevance: Overview of Spanish conquest
media.notes: Simple History channel; animated

media.title: TED-Ed: What Really Happened During the Salem Witch Trials
media.relevance: Colonial America witch trials
media.notes: Colonial era context

media.title: Life in the 13 Colonies
media.relevance: Overview of colonial life
media.notes: Mr. Beat channel; comprehensive

topics.name: American Revolution Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about the causes and events of the American Revolution

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: No More Kings
media.relevance: Animated song about colonial rebellion
media.notes: Classic Schoolhouse Rock

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Shot Heard Round the World
media.relevance: Start of the Revolution song
media.notes: Memorable song about Lexington & Concord

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: Fireworks
media.relevance: Declaration of Independence song
media.notes: Explains Declaration writing

media.title: Oversimplified: The American Revolution (Part 1)
media.relevance: Animated humorous overview of Revolution
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging animation

media.title: Oversimplified: The American Revolution (Part 2)
media.relevance: Continuation covering war and victory
media.notes: Covers war through Treaty of Paris

media.title: TED-Ed: What You Might Not Know About the Declaration of Independence
media.relevance: Lesser-known facts about Declaration
media.notes: Interesting historical details

topics.name: Government & Civics Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about US government, Constitution, and citizenship

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Preamble
media.relevance: Constitution preamble set to music
media.notes: ESSENTIAL - helps memorize preamble

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: I'm Just a Bill
media.relevance: How a bill becomes law
media.notes: ESSENTIAL - classic civics education

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: Three Ring Government
media.relevance: Three branches of government
media.notes: Circus metaphor for branches

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: Elbow Room
media.relevance: Westward expansion song
media.notes: Manifest Destiny concept

media.title: TED-Ed: Why is the US Constitution So Hard to Amend?
media.relevance: Amendment process explained
media.notes: Good for civics understanding

media.title: The Bill of Rights in 5 Minutes
media.relevance: Quick overview of first 10 amendments
media.notes: Concise Bill of Rights summary

topics.name: Expansion & Civil War Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about westward expansion, slavery, and the Civil War

media.title: Oversimplified: The Civil War (Part 1)
media.relevance: Animated overview of Civil War causes and early war
media.notes: Engaging animated history

media.title: Oversimplified: The Civil War (Part 2)
media.relevance: Later Civil War and aftermath
media.notes: Covers war end through Reconstruction

media.title: TED-Ed: The Atlantic Slave Trade: What Too Few Textbooks Told You
media.relevance: Important context on Atlantic slave trade
media.notes: Important historical context

media.title: The Underground Railroad Explained
media.relevance: How the Underground Railroad worked
media.notes: Explains network and key figures

media.title: TED-Ed: Harriet Tubman: The Life and Times of a Conductor
media.relevance: Harriet Tubman biography
media.notes: Excellent Tubman overview

media.title: Simple History: The Trail of Tears
media.relevance: Cherokee removal explained
media.notes: Animated explanation of forced removal

media.title: BrainPOP: Civil War
media.relevance: Civil War overview for students
media.notes: Requires BrainPOP subscription

topics.name: Western Hemisphere Geography Quick Clips
topics.description: Short videos about geography of North and South America

media.title: Geography Now: Canada
media.relevance: Comprehensive look at Canada
media.notes: Geography Now channel; thorough

media.title: Geography Now: Mexico
media.relevance: Comprehensive look at Mexico
media.notes: Covers geography, culture, history

media.title: Geography Now: Brazil
media.relevance: Comprehensive look at Brazil
media.notes: Largest South American country

media.title: Countries of North America Geography
media.relevance: All North American countries
media.notes: Quick continental overview

media.title: Countries of South America Geography
media.relevance: All South American countries
media.notes: Quick continental overview
